i moved the queen of pop statement where it belongs - i hope this pleases everyone so we can move on from this silly war
rv to correct details per guinness book of records
Removed psedonyms category. "Madonna" is and always was her legal first name, hence it is not a pseudonym

Revert to revision 102548944 dated 2007-01-22 23:51:42 by Gerrish using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
Added link to new article about Madonna's next album.
/* Acting career */ chester gould isn't that popular, though the comic strip may be.
/* David Banda adoption */ thorough cleanup - how long this ran, plauged with POV and dire lack of citations!
/* Relationships and family */ removing uncitated tabloid rumours and cleaning it all up in order to concentrate on the raw facts
Let's compromise and settle this once and for all Forbes is there. Confessions Tour stays. I'm being honest. Not trying to glamourize her or anything. CT is pertinent info. Others agree too.
"It easily goes hand in hand with "highest earning"." You could say the same thing about the Forbes magazine info. CT is more pertinent than Forbes magaizine info. Not mean to idolize her.
I'm just TRYING to make compromise to please everyone.
Put "Queen of Pop" back there instead of The Queen Of Pop. Still can't see the big deal...
Removed QOP and Madge from aliases. Did not put them there. Don't blast me!
Are we adults or kids? How come we have to argue on the dumbest things. The Queen Of Pop was replaced by "Queen of Pop". BIG DEAL?!
Someone deleted most of the criticism section. Put it back there.
Nothing wrong with The Confessions Tour info. Not meant to glamourize her. It is a FACT, was there for weeks and added by others. More pertinent than Forbes info.
Keep "Confessions Tour" OUT of the opening paragraph. This is NOT A PUBLICITY BLURB,, like Rossrs stated. It easily goes hand in hand with "highest earning".
I'm sorry but I'm not the one that added the Confessions Tour info. Also, that info was there for weeks and everyone accepted it. Why removing it now? You're the ones that don't discuss changes.
/* Criticism */ If the Live To Tell lyrics can't stay there, the love Profusion line can't stay neither. Copyrighted too.
/* Criticism */ rm copyrighted content which doesn't belong here anyway
/* Criticism */ please provide citations if you want these claims back
rv: npov - please discuss further changes before making them

Other people, not me, added QOP. It was there for WEEKS and accepted. And why was "fashion trendsetter" removed? It was there for WEEKS and added by others...
The Confessions tour info was added by OTHERS and there for weeks. Why some people always want to remove everything?
Moved "Queen of Pop" nonsense to second opening paragraph
Opening salvo - Removed "Confessions Tour". This is unimportant to the intro.
Opening salvo - "or sometimes just the Queen"???? SICK. Also moved Forbes blurb.

rv Ritchie. Someone added it awhile ago.
Please, listen. I DID NOT write "commonly referred to" , "innovative", and "elaborately mounted". Others wrote those things and they were there for WEEKS. Only you have a problem with them.
known as a fashion trensetter is not correct. "known to be" or "also a fashion trendsetter are better" innovative and elaborated were added by others and there for weeks
You cannot say "known as a fashion trensetter". The correct phrasing is "known to be a fashion trendsetter".
Someone removed "commonly referred to as the Queen of Pop". It was there for weeks, most people agreed, and there are countless sources.
/* 2003–2007: Commercial ups and downs */ there's no evidence on this.

Revert to revision 99336849 dated 2007-01-08 15:47:00 by Mhking using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
/* Criticism */ consolidating counterexamples into one paragraph, adding an external source for "poignant"
/* Criticism */ The Love Profusion review shamelessly deemed the line ridiculous and retarded. I added one line that got a good review and a source. I wish that edit is gonna be the final one.
/* Criticism */ "I know I feel bad when I get in a bad mood" are pretty RIDICULOUS, even for a RETARD. If that line is there, there MUST be at least one good line too.
/* Criticism */ Balance is one thing, but cheerleading is another thing entirely. Please stop with the fan cruft.
/* Criticism */ reorder section, so that those lyrics are presented in context of discussion about lyrics. I still have no idea what these lyrical samples are supposed to be illustrating.
Madonna's birth name is Madonna Louise, not Maria Louise Veronica
/* Short films */ incorrect - Madonna did not 'star opposite' - she is the only person of note in the film. Other actors are in seperate films within 'The Hire' series.
/* External links */ remove external link spam
/* External links */ Removed duplicate link, added memorabilia site
The lyrics are available on madonna.com, the official website. Changed the weblinks. The Love Profusion review was quite offensive. Almost an insult. I'm just trying to balance it.
Ok, illustrate the point somehow, but not by linking to a copyvio site. If you can demonstrate that the site has permission to host those lyrics, please do so.

"we also know she can't write lyrics, but lines like, "I know I feel bad when I get in a bad mood" are pretty ridiculous, even for a retard" If the article says that it needs to show other lyrics too!
/* Criticism */ It's not clear what these example lyrics are conveying, nor that the site hosting them has permission - it says "Not endorsed by Madonna, Warner Brothers, or Maverick Entertainment."
/* Criticism */ rm a couple of words
moved [[Madonna (singer/actress)]] to [[Madonna (entertainer)]]: rv, if u want to move the page discuss it first in the talkpage
stray sentence, "matriculated" = listed, start to copyed
moved [[Madonna (entertainer)]] to [[Madonna (singer/actress)]]: appropriate description for Madonna
/* Criticism */ this sentence makes no sense to me - what is it saying? Why are those two clauses joined with a "but"?
I was ALLOWED to BALANCE the Criticism section. I ONLY mentioned her LDLHA cover and a few lines she wrote. NO personal opinions at all. I respected all the guidelines.
that doesn't belong in the infobox

/* Criticism */ I understand that this is not a fan site but it ain't an anti-Madonna site NEITHER. I followed your advice and tried to balance the criticism section.
The Official Warner The Confessions Tour DVD release sheet says 200 million albums, not records -implying albums and singles-.
removing Objectiveness section. Once again, this is NOT a fan site; if you have a problem with the Criticism, balance that section. Do not introduce cheerleading.
User Meeples and User 84.45.196.194 agreed to let it there after the changes were made to make it as NEUTRAL as possible in order to balance the negativity of the Criticism section. Edited it again.
It's an alias. Not legal. She's also known as Madonna Louise Veronica Ciccone Ritchie. It's common to include confirmation name in someone's name and that was there for weeks.
rv; by definition, a Confirmation is not an individual's "middle" name.
moved [[Madonna (Entertainer)]] to [[Madonna (entertainer)]]: decaptializing "entertainer", not a proper noun
/* Objectiveness */ rm objectiveness section. This is NOT a fan site, and has no place here.
Issues about her real name see ref.
Let's not turn tthis into a war. There was an agreement. The Objectiveness section could remain on the article as long as it was edited and it was. Why not disuss it on the Madonna discussion page?

I edited the Objectiveness section. Addde sources too. If it's out of place, the criticism section-which WAS full of rants is out of place too. I'm just being objective.
That belongs to the discussion section. Also, the criticism section was made by someone that admitted to hating Madonna. I wrote song titles. that's where the lyrics came from.
